Uses of Interface
platform.game.World

  • Packages that use World 
    Package Description
    platform.game
    Base package of the game's engine.
    platform.game.button
    Package containing all Button-related Actors.
    platform.game.level
    Package containing all Levels.
    platform.game.linkable
    Package containing all linkable Actors.
    platform.game.signal
    Package containing all Signals.

    • Uses of World in platform.game

      Classes in platform.game that implement World 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Simulator
      Basic implementation of world, managing a complete collection of actors.
      Fields in platform.game declared as World 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private World Actor.world
      All spawned actors have a direct link with their World
      Methods in platform.game that return World 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected World Actor.getWorld()
      Returns the Actor's World.
      Methods in platform.game with parameters of type World 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Overlay.register(World world) 
      void Actor.register(World world)
      Registers this actor by setting its World to the World entered.

    • Uses of World in platform.game.linkable

      Methods in platform.game.linkable with parameters of type World 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Mover.register(World world)
      The following method has to be overridden to register all the signals it contains so it can be loaded in the new world and be visible.
      void Exit.register(World world)
      The following method has to be overridden to register all the signals it contains so it can be loaded in the new world and be visible.
      void Door.register(World world)
      The following method has to be overridden to register all the signals it contains so it can be loaded in the new world and be visible.
      void Door.unregister(World world)
      No need for it, the Actor's unregister suffices.

    • Uses of World in platform.game.signal

      Methods in platform.game.signal with parameters of type World 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Signal.register(World world)
      Registers all sub Signals (if they exist) in the world so the level can be reloaded without any problem.
      void Or.register(World world)
      Register both Signals so they appear correctly in the World.
      void Not.register(World world)
      Register the Signal so it appears correctly in the World.
      void Constant.register(World world)
      Unlike other signals, can't do anything since the value is not a Signal (nor an Actor).
      void And.register(World world) 
      void Torch.unregister(World world)
      No need for it, the Actor's unregister suffices.
      void Signal.unregister(World world)
      Unregisters all sub Signals (if they exist) off the world so the level can be without any problem.
      void Oscillator.unregister(World world)
      Unlike other signals, can't do anything since the value is not a Signal (nor an Actor).
      void Or.unregister(World world)
      Unregister both Signals so they appear correctly in the World.
      void Not.unregister(World world)
      Unregister the Signal so it appears correctly in the World.
      void Lever.unregister(World world)
      No need for it, the Actor's unregister suffices.
      void Key.unregister(World world)
      No need for it, the Actor's unregister suffices.
      void Constant.unregister(World world)
      Unlike other signals, can't do anything since the value is not a Signal (nor an Actor).
      void And.unregister(World world)
